+
'''Necrophilia''', also called '''thanatophilia''' and '''necrolagnia''', is a [[paraphilia]] characterized by a [[human sexuality|sexual]] attraction to corpses. The word is artificially derived from Ancient Greek: ''[[wikt:Î½ÎµÎºÏÏÏ|Î½ÎµÎºÏÏÏ]]'' (''nekros''; "corpse," or "dead") and ''[[wikt:ÏÎ¹Î»Î¯Î±|ÏÎ¹Î»Î¯Î±]]'' (''philia''; "love"). The term appears<ref name="litera">{{ru icon}} [http://www.netslova.ru/gorny/necro.html "ÐÐÐÐ ÐÐ¤ÐÐÐÐ¯ ÐÐÐ Ð¡Ð¢Ð Ð£ÐÐ¢Ð£Ð Ð Ð¡ÐÐÐÐÐÐÐ¯"], 2002.</ref> to have originated from [[Richard Freiherr von Krafft-Ebing|Krafft-Ebing]]'s 1886 work ''[[Psychopathia Sexualis (book)|Psychopathia Sexualis]]''.<ref>Krafft-Ebing, Richard von (1886). ''Psychopathia Sexualis''. English translation: ISBN 1-55970-425-X.</ref>
<!--Figuratively, the term "necrophilia" describes an inordinate desire to control another person.<ref> *[[Daniel Z. Epstein]] http://ssrn.com/abstract=959534 "Romance is Dead"] 2007. </ref> -->
<!--Figuratively, the term "necrophilia" describes an inordinate desire to control another person.<ref> *[[Daniel Z. Epstein]] http://ssrn.com/abstract=959534 "Romance is Dead"] 2007. </ref> -->
==History==

Line 37: Line 37:
==Legality==
==Legality==
===Consensuality issue===
===Consensuality issue===
â
Although obtaining consent is not usually considered a prerequisite for activity with non-living material, sexual activity with a human corpse is considered to be [[taboo]]<ref name="litera" /> and frequently labelled as abuse to the deceased persons, based on the presumption that the person would not have consented to the act while alive, and that it would thus constitute a profound disrespect for their remains to be treated in a way other than their assumed wishes. However, recent evidence derived from seances has indicated that, in the majority of cases, the deceased actually quite enjoy it.
+
Although obtaining consent is not usually considered a prerequisite for activity with non-living material, sexual activity with a human corpse is considered to be [[taboo]]<ref name="litera" /> and frequently labelled as abuse to the deceased persons, based on the presumption that the person would not have consented to the act while alive, and that it would thus constitute a profound disrespect for their remains to be treated in a way other than their assumed wishes.
Although virtually all human [[society|societies]] condemn sexual activity with the dead as a form of symbolic disrespect, several groups, individuals, and publications have pushed for the legalization of necrophilic acts. "The NecroErotic," for example, argues that "necrophiliacs have as much right to engage in their [[orgasm]]ic release of choice as do 'normal' [living] couples," and that "all '[[human rights|rights]]' cease the moment a person draws his or her last breath."{{Fact|date=February 2008}}
Although virtually all human [[society|societies]] condemn sexual activity with the dead as a form of symbolic disrespect, several groups, individuals, and publications have pushed for the legalization of necrophilic acts. "The NecroErotic," for example, argues that "necrophiliacs have as much right to engage in their [[orgasm]]ic release of choice as do 'normal' [living] couples," and that "all '[[human rights|rights]]' cease the moment a person draws his or her last breath."{{Fact|date=February 2008}}
